dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 976 RH: 1071 Repeal to Protect Small Business Lending Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Williams of Texas (for himself, Mr. Huizenga, Mr. Flood, Mr. Meuser, Mrs. Wagner, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Nunn of Iowa, Mr. Downing, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Haridopolos, Mr. Lucas, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. Finstad, Mr. Moore of North Carolina, Mr. Barr, Mr. Collins, Mr. Davidson, Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Bergman, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Norman, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Ezell, Mr. Yakym, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Grothman, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Gill of Texas, Mr. Taylor, and Ms. Van Duyne) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

Additional sponsors: Ms. Hageman, Mr. Murphy, Mr. Graves, Mr. Guest, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Schmidt, Mr. Fitzgerald, Mr. Palmer, Mr. Stutzman, Mr. Kelly of Mississippi, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Mann, Mr. Smith of Nebraska, Mr. Cloud, Mr. Goldman of Texas, Mr. Carter of Texas, Mr. Self, Mr. Lawler, Mr. Rose, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Alford, and Mr. Wied
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 4, 2025

form.official-title: To repeal the small business loan data collection requirements under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the 1071 Repeal to Protect Small Business Lending Act.

paragraph.text: Section 704B of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, as added by section 1071 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, imposes data collection and reporting requirements on financial institutions regarding small business loans.
These requirements have resulted in increased compliance costs for financial institutions, potentially reducing access to credit for small businesses.
The regulatory burdens created by these requirements disproportionately impact smaller financial institutions, such as community banks and credit unions, which are critical to small business lending.
Repealing these requirements will reduce regulatory barriers and support greater access to credit for small businesses.

section.header: Repeal of the small business loan data collection requirements

subsection.text: Section 704B of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691c–2) is repealed.

paragraph.header: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act amendments
paragraph.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the table of contents in section 1(b) of such Act, by striking the item relating to section 1071; and

paragraph.text: The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the table of contents for such Act, by striking the item relating to section 704B; and

clause.text: in paragraph (3), by adding or at the end;
in paragraph (4), by striking ; or and inserting a period; and

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
